title: [Large-Scale] Evidence-Based Language Instructional Design Simulation for Improving Retention in Nursing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental nursing theory and practical experience, proficiency in medical terminology, and structured text composition skills
context.additional_context: Targets mid-level professionals responsible for organizational education operations. Requires customized content reflecting diverse learning styles, with a focus on language use (grammar, vocabulary, discourse structure) appropriate for medical contexts.

learning_goals: Learners linguistically design nursing education scenarios that apply at least three learning styles (visual/auditory/kinesthetic) via VR simulations.

Develop educational materials for five key nursing skills (medication administration, wound care, patient monitoring, etc.) using evidence-based pedagogy, incorporating professional terminology and structured text.
Establish strategies to improve learner engagement and educational effectiveness by at least 20% through formative assessments, utilizing linguistic feedback and expression techniques.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
